label: axiom-rescale-function
statement: Axiom of a Well-Behaved Rescale Function
mathematical_expression: g_A: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0} \text{ must satisfy: } (1) \text{ } C^1 \text{ smoothness}, (2) \text{ } g'_A(z) \ge 0 \text{ } \forall z \in \mathbb{R}, (3) \text{ range } (0, g_{A,\max}], (4) \text{ } \sup_{z \in \mathbb{R}} |g'_A(z)| = L_{g_A} < \infty
name: Axiom of a Well-Behaved Rescale Function

parameters.description: Rescale function that transforms standardized scores (Z-scores) to positive fitness components in the fitness potential operator
Standardized score (Z-score) input to the rescale function
Upper bound constant for the rescale function range - ensures uniform boundedness to prevent infinite fitness
Lipschitz constant for the rescale function - uniform bound on the derivative ensuring global Lipschitz continuity

failure_mode_analysis: Violating any of the four properties makes the algorithm unpredictable or unstable: (1) Without C^1 smoothness, discontinuous jumps in fitness destabilize the cloning dynamics; (2) Without monotonicity (g'_A(z) â‰¥ 0), higher standardized scores could result in lower fitness, breaking logical ordering and making better walkers less fit; (3) Without uniform boundedness to (0, g_{A,max}], infinite fitness breaks probability calculations and selection stability; (4) Without global Lipschitz continuity (bounded derivative L_{g_A}), small changes in standardized scores can be pathologically amplified, breaking the mean-square continuity of the composite Fitness Potential Operator and leading to unstable swarm behavior.
